sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"造反，叛乱，骚乱"之意。
means: rebellion ： 通常指有组织、公开地大规模武断叛乱，着以失败而告终。
revolt ： 指规模相对较小的，持续时间较短，侧重对压迫或不能容忍的情况的反抗。
riot ： 多指没有组织的一群人突然掀起的闹事。也可指暴乱或暴动。

sentence.Network_en: Soon the entire armed forces were in open revolt.
sentence.Network_cn: 很快，整个武装部队开始公然抗命。

sentence.Network_en: The newly-occupied Italian colony of Libya rose in revolt in 1914.
sentence.Network_cn: 意大利新占领的殖民地利比亚于1914年发生叛乱。

sentence.Network_en: It was undeniably a revolt by ordinary people against their leaders.
sentence.Network_cn: 不可否认，这是一场平民百姓反抗领导人的起义。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from French révolte (noun), révolter (verb), from Italian rivoltare, based on Latin revolvere 'roll back' (see revolve)

encyclopedia.content: 遥控赛车(Revolt) 遥控赛车是1999年推出的一款经典赛车游戏，虽然它标注的配置不高，不过以当时的硬件配置来玩这款游戏并不十分流畅，时至今日，我们来回顾这款可玩性极强的赛车游戏，就会发现这款多年前的游戏画质还是十分出众，这里特别推荐给喜爱赛车游戏的玩家。游戏评测 画面： 这款3D赛车游戏支持最高1280×1024的分辨率，进入游戏后你会感觉到游戏的画面相当不错，画面元素丰富，遥控车的动作也非常灵敏，各种模拟真实环境

entry.def: A revolt is an illegal and often violent attempt by a group of people to change their country's political system.

example.ex: It was undeniably a revolt by ordinary people against their leaders...
example.tran: 不可否认，这是一场平民百姓反抗领导人的起义。

example.ex: The newly-occupied Italian colony of Libya rose in revolt in 1914.
example.tran: 意大利新占领的殖民地利比亚于1914年发生叛乱。

entry.def: When people revolt, they make an illegal and often violent attempt to change their country's political system.

example.ex: Zanzibar's fortunes declined after the islanders revolted against the sultanate in 1964.
example.tran: 桑给巴尔岛的居民于1964年反抗苏丹统治，随后时局便不断恶化。

entry.def: A revolt by a person or group against someone or something is a refusal to accept the authority of that person or thing.

example.ex: The prime minister is facing a revolt by party activists over his refusal to hold a referendum...
example.tran: 因为拒绝进行公民投票，首相正面临着党内激进分子的反抗。

example.ex: Soon the entire armed forces were in open revolt.
example.tran: 很快，整个武装部队开始公然抗命。

entry.def: When people revolt against someone or something, they reject the authority of that person or reject that thing.

example.ex: The prime minister only reacted when three of his senior cabinet colleagues revolted and resigned in protest on Friday night...
example.tran: 直到周五晚上首相的3位高级内阁同僚倒戈并辞职以示抗议时，首相才有所反应。

example.ex: Caroline revolted against her ballet training at sixteen.
example.tran: 卡罗琳16岁时拒绝接受芭蕾舞训练。

means.word_mean: 1. organized opposition to authority; a conflict in which one faction tries to wrest control from another

sentences.sentence: "The people revolted when bread prices tripled again"

means.word_mean: 3. cause aversion in; offend the moral sense of;

auth_sentence.content: One company trimmed perks after an unusual shareholder revolt.
auth_sentence.res_content: One company trimmed perks after an unusual shareholder revolt.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One company trimmed perks after an unusual shareholder revolt.

auth_sentence.content: If Ramush is acquitted, the north will revolt.
auth_sentence.res_content: If Ramush is acquitted, the north will revolt.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: If Ramush is acquitted, the north will revolt.

auth_sentence.content: Ottomans return to north, but later face revolt.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ottomans return to north, but later face revolt.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ottomans return to north, but later face revolt.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"回,向后,相反,不"; 2. 表示"一再,重新"

stems_affixes.word_buile: re回+pugn打+ant……的→[把人]打回去→[行为]令人厌恶的
re回,向后,相反,不+son声音+ant……的→声音回过来→回响的
re反+vers转+e→反转的
re一再,重新+splend光辉+ent……的→再光辉→辉煌的
re回,向后,相反,不+neg否认+ade个人或集体→反过来否认原的[党]→背叛者
re回,向后,相反,不+peal驱动→反驱动→取消;参考:appeal呼吁
re不+prob正直+ate人→不正直→败坏
re向后+st站→立于后面者→其他的[人,物]
re一再,重新+cidiv掉下+ism行为,现象→再次掉入罪行
re一再,重新+pose放→再放下[工作]→休息
re一再,重新+surg升起,浪潮+ence表名词→重起浪潮→复兴
re回,向后,相反,不+proach接近→不接近→指责
re反+volt转→反过转→反叛
re回+call喊;想→回想
re回+flect弯曲→弯曲返回→反射
re回,向后,相反,不+linqu离开+ish表动词→离开不再要→放弃
re回,向后,相反,不+mov运动,移动+e→移开,消除
re回,向后,相反,不+pel推→击退
re反+sent感觉→反感→不满
re反+sist站→反着站→反抗
re回+tract拉→拉回,缩回
re回+treat→v.后退,撤退
re一再,重新+arrange安排→v.重新安排
re一再,重新+assure确保→v.消除某人疑虑
re一再,重新+capit头+ulate=ate表动词→重新把头拿出来→概括要点
re一再,重新+claim喊→喊回来→取回,引申为开垦荒地
re一再,重新+commend赞扬→一再赞扬
re一再,重新+furbish装饰→再装饰→刷新
re一再,重新+in入+carn肉+ate表动词→重新进入肉体→产生
re一再,重新+in入+state国家,权力→重新进入权力
re一再,重新+iterate重说→反复重说

stems_affixes.value_cn: 描述,表示,象征;代表;阐明
stems_affixes.word_buile: re一再+present出席的;上演→一再上演,出席的→象征;代表
re一再,重新+produce生产,制造→v. 生殖;再现;繁殖;复制
re一再,重新+verber震动+ate表动词→重新震动→起回声

stems_affixes.value_cn: [建]拱门饰, 拱门内侧的穹窿
stems_affixes.word_buile: archi=arch弓,拱形+volt转,卷→转成拱形
re反+volt转→反过转→反叛

Sentence.sentence: Within the wider business world, a man who liked to see himself as a hippy （嬉皮士）, permanently in revolt against big companies, ended up being hailed by many of those corporate giants as one of the greatest chief executives of his time.

means.word_mean: (使)厌恶, 使惊骇, 令人厌恶

sentences.en: The violence in the movie revolted me.
sentences.cn: 电影里的暴力行为使我反感。

means.word_mean: 反叛; 反抗; 背叛; 叛逆; 违抗

sentences.en: His whole nature revolted against deceit.
sentences.cn: 他生来就对欺骗行为反感。

sentences.en: The tribesmen will revolt if you ask them to pay taxes.
sentences.cn: 你若要求部落里的人们交税, 他们会反叛的。

means.word_mean: 造反, 起义, （尤指针对政府的）反抗, 违抗, 起义, 叛乱

sentences.en: The governor convened his troops to put down the revolt.
sentences.cn: 总督召集他的部队去镇压叛乱。

jushi.english: The tribesmen will revolt if you ask them to pay taxes.
jushi.chinese: 你若要求部落里的人们交税,他们会反叛的。

jushi.english: A puppet troop revolted last week.
jushi.chinese: 上星期一支伪军部队起义了。
